constraints.description: Employment Contracts Act is general law applying to all employment relationships
Defines minimum level for terms of employment
Indefinite employment is the general rule
Fixed-term employment requires justified reason (substitution, training, project work)
Trial period maximum is 6 months
During trial period, either party can terminate without notice
Termination during trial period cannot be for discriminatory reasons
Fixed-term employment trial period maximum is half of contract duration
Sick pay right applies only if employment relationship lasts more than 1 month
Right to full salary from first sick day + 9 following days
Employer must have justified and substantial reason for termination
Dismissal only for very substantial reasons
Unjustified termination may result in compensation of 3-24 months' salary
Employer has general duty to promote employee relations and ensure work ability
Employer must ensure equal treatment and prohibit discrimination
Employer must protect employees from accidents and hazards
Employee must perform work carefully and according to instructions
Employee has loyalty obligation prohibiting competing activities and revealing trade secrets
Employee must follow safety instructions
Employee must report safety deficiencies
